author: Brendan
title: tshirt and a lego set....
review:
Got this set last night at Wal-Mart here in West Virginia. It was attached to a tshirt in the kids section. They had several of these available with different designs on the tshirt but all were construction themed. I have a son who is equally enthusiatic about lego so i gave him the shirt and kept the set.
     Easy build...took about 25 seconds. Standard lego face. Just a standard set. I wasnt expecting anything spectacular out of a polybag set so i was not disappointed. T shirt and set were 10 USD.

author: tisi
title: Cheap little dozer
review:
Well, I live in Hungary, and we were veeeeery lucky in Hungary two years before. At that time, 5627 and 30042 appeared in Tesco stores. Those sets cost 390 HUF (~1,7 dollars!) which is even less then the retail price of a collectible minifig! So I picked up this one and the Mini Sub too. Well, I felt strangely about it...

Box/Instructions

No box, because it's a polybag set with some warnings on the back in dozens of languages. We get a small folded instruction sheet with it, and it advertises HARBOUR sets! Kind of strange for me, because it's a construction set. But it doesn't matter, go forward.

Parts

23 pieces and no extras. Not so much. Mainly classic elements, but the rare digger bucket also appeared. We get a pickaxe and a motor hammer, but it would be better if TLG put some material to doze (three 1x1 studs would be still OK).

Minifigures

The dozer is driven by a happy construction worker - standard figure, but I like it because of his cool orange clothes and the red helmet. His head even looks like a real worker's. 

The build

Nothing special. It's base is a 2x4 plate, you put the wheels downstairs, the digger bucket, the chair and the steering wheel upstairs, and you are finished. It takes ~2 minutes to build

The completed model

The small dozer looks neat, but a bit unrealistic. Well, you can doze away your bricks with it.

Summary

I bought it for its price, because I needed one more worker guy. Under 3 dollars it's a good buy because of the minifig and some rare elements. The dozer itself is weird, but cute. If you really need to have a machine with digger bucket, buy it immediately. If you don't, get it if it's cheap.

Thanks for reading and sorry for my English grammar knowledge :D.
